CONVERSATION GROUP: BK Although the five ships get most of the attention, we, the members of Bregan D'aerthe, are the only ones with a true understanding of what really goes on in Luskan.

BK Our organization has been keeping tabs on you since you arrived. You're involved in quite the number of plots and machinations, and although you operate more overtly than we do, your methods have proven quite effective.
BK There are a lot of going-ons in Luskan, and we believe that someone like you could be quite helpful to us.
What would you have me do?
BK Most disconcerting as of late is the rise of cult activity in Luskan. We've always had a few minor cults lingering in the shadows, but rarely have they acted so brazenly.
In one case, a well-known Luskan trader, Bertrand Lucere, was murdered in his own house and some of his recent acquisitions were taken.
The common thread between the two is that similar relics were taken in each instance. We do not know the purpose of those relics, but they appear abyssal in nature. These crimes are no coincidence.
BK That's a shame. Opportunities to work with Bregan D'aerthe are quite rare, and you will not have another chance. Are you sure you want to reject our offer?
BK I don't really trust people who hang out in sewers. No thanks.
BK Opportunities to work with Bregan D'aerthe are quite rare and a true honor. Our organization has connections in every realm. We can open doors that others cannot.

BK Good. You should visit Bertrand's daughter, Indra, at their house in Luskan for more information about the murder. As for the Rethnor attack, perhaps you can speak with some of their members in Luskan to learn more.
BK converted this from Player response to end conversation to get rid of the "yes, we can do this" repeat

BK I've made fairly big changes to the structure of this dialog. It felt uneven to me when I first read it. Hopefully I did not break things...
BK Ah, so you finally showed up.
BK We have something for you. A letter from Beniago.
Very well. I see you have proven yourself capable of discerning friend from foe and making difficult decisions. Bregan D'aerthe is pleased with Dalanir's decision to end the life of his hated sister.
BK I call it Crescent Fang, and I don't know where it came from. What I do know is that it holds great power, especially against our people. Take it, and use it with caution.

BK - This line terminated the conversation but because a flag was set on opening line it did not appear the players would be able to resume the conversation... so I linked this into the discussion (instead of having it just end).
BK We have something for you. A letter from Beniago.

Brent Knowles: not sure if I'm doing this right but becase you can enter this node from State 1 "You finally arrived" or State 2 "Have you resolved..." I'm trying to accomodate an "ending node" with State 2 but a continuation of the discussion with State 1.
JAW: For HOTU-25563 - Fixed this line (as it was incorrectly duped) and fixed the flag as well.
BK Yes, but there seems to be quite a bit of cult activity in Luskan. What is going on?
BK Each cult had one of these to these statues. Do you know anything about them?
BK Yes... It was exactly as I suspected...
BK Now we can complete our masters plan.
I don't enjoy being toyed with. Prepare yourself!
BK So my information was correct. Good work. Did you find anything?
BK Yes, cult activity has obviously been on the rise. Did you find anything?
BK It was easy to sit back and watch you do our work for us.
We have always been three steps ahead of those fools!
BK too modern : You guys really messed things up back there.
What kinds of opponents are we dealing with?

BK This line was unfair since we don't give the players the chance to detect illusions (as far as I know)
BK I would have assumed you would check for a simple illusion before handing over abyssal relics. I guess I was wrong.
Considering the way they act in-tandem, I suspect they're priests of that two-headed primate, Demogorgon. And with those relics, I suspect they'll try to open a portal straight to the Gaping Maw.
BK I was down here investigating their chamber when they showed up with the relics you gave them. They ambushed me and barred the door.
I think we should fight together.
I agree. We can't afford to fail here.
Yes. And we should fight them together. We simply cannot afford to fail.
In particular, this is going to reflect well on me personally. We've had our missteps, but I'm glad I trusted you.
I knew you'd be expecting a reward, and I have one for you. When you're done here, meet me back at our usual location.
I'll be taking those relics with me, as well, so no need to concern yourself with their disposal.
BK Good, you are still alive. And just in time for us to test our new powers.
You might have defeated us just a moment ago. But now? You stand no chance.
What exactly are these relics, anyway?
Enough talk. It's time to battle.
BK There are many eyes watching this city. Especially from the Abyss.
It is much simpler to operate from the darkness. Your involvement was merely a matter of timing and convenience.
BK Even we do not know. But many powers seem to want them.
BK And as our master has shown us, they can grant enormous power.
BK Although the five ships get most of the attention, we, the members of Bregan D'aerthe, are the only ones with a true understanding of what really goes on in Luskan.

BK Our organization has been keeping tabs on you since you arrived. You're involved in quite the number of plots and machinations, and although you operate more overtly than we do, your methods have proven quite effective.
BK There are a lot of going-ons in Luskan, and we believe that someone like you could be quite helpful to us.

BK I don't really trust people who hang out in sewers. No thanks.
BK Opportunities to work with Bregan D'aerthe are quite rare and a true honor. Our organization has connections in every realm. We can open doors that others cannot.

BK Good. You should visit Bertrand's daughter, Indra, at their house in Luskan for more information about the murder. As for the Rethnor attack, perhaps you can speak with some of their members in Luskan to learn more.
